intro: Tithymalus robustus, commonly known as the robust tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges or disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
